body:
Comment 10: 
Making methods and method sets a property of the type rather than a type name is the
correct solution (and this is what rsc's CL 5702062 effectively is doing. It (finally!)
disentangles the type name from properties of the type.

As a result another inconsistency in the spec disappears: In a type declaration, a name
is bound to a type. That type, if it had any anonymous fields with methods embedded but
were standing alone (not in a declaration), would not have any methods. Standing with
the type declaration, that type all of sudden does not lose its methods: i.e., type and
type name are not orthogonal.
